So, uh, what exactly is meant by switching modes at 800 m/s?

> 
> So, uh, what exactly is meant by switching modes at 800 m/s?

That's because of Krakensbane ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/12-Krakensbane](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/12-Krakensbane)

Basically, the game compute velocity calculations in relative or absolute modes to avoid floating point errors - the speed treshold between the two modes is around 800m/s - and the krakendrives behave differently in the two modes. When under the treshold, it acts as an antigravity anchor, only going at 5m/s max, while over this treshold it acts as a propellantless thruster. If you are at high speeds but below the treshold, the drive will try to instantly slow back down to 5m/s - while the rest of your craft still has it's mass wanting to go forward - generaly resulting in the kraken immediate retaliation ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

(The same can happen when you're going to a body with low orbital speeds, like the mÃƒÂ¼n - if you engage a krakendrive with orbital speed below the treshold)
